intro: Hedypnois rhagadioloides subsp. monspeliensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean starwort, is a small perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
